metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5488 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in wp-admin/update-core.php in WordPress before 4.7.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) name or (2) version header of a plugin.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-5488` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.7.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.7.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.7.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.7.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.7.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.7.1+dfsg-1').
